intro: Oligosporus campestris subsp. caudatus, commonly known as the curly dock, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its rosette of broad, wavy leaves and distinctive, club-shaped inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a terminal cluster. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a common weed in agricultural fields. Its botanical features make it easily identifiable and adaptable to various environmental conditions.
